channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14087] ensure correct ASF policy compliant headers on source/docs
item.description:
• we have a couple of files that are missing their headers.
  • we have one file using old-style ASF copyrights
item.summary: ensure correct ASF policy compliant headers on source/docs

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
for the curious, the second point is covered by

http://apache.org/legal/src-headers.html

we have a few files with the old style "copyright the ASF" header.


$ grep -rl -E "[cC]opyright [0-9]* [tT]he [aA]pache [sS]oftware [fF]oundation" *

Missing headers would be a blocker. Maybe we can help unblock RCs by fixing the old style licenses out of band though?
I'm reasonably sure this part is done now. let me grab the patch out of my working repo.

-01

  • adds missing headers
  • corrects some old-form headers to current
  • restores proper header for guava copied LimitInputStream
  • adds proper header for protobuf copied read/writeRawVarint

I'm not sure about including the header fixups with the license corrections (around the guava / protobuf stuff).

I'm still waiting for confirmation from Jimmy Xiang about the provenance of the code in ProtoUtil, but I've included a preliminary fix based on what I could determine.
